PreparerFirmBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1: FRIED AND KOWGIOS PARTNERS CPA'S LLP

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO SERVE THE PEOPLE BY PROVIDING A BROAD SPECTRUM OF QUALITY ENTERTAINMENT AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE PRIMARY MISSION OF THE COUNT BASIE THEATRE IS TO SERVE THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY BY PROVIDING A BROAD SPECTRUM OF QUALITY ENTERTAINMENT AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT REFLECT AND CELEBRATE THE DIVERSITY OF THE REGION; FOSTER UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR THE ENNOBLING POWER OF THE PERFORMING ARTS AND CREATE OPPORTUNITY FOR CULTURAL ENRICHMENT FOR PEOPLE AT ALL ECONOMIC LEVELS. IT ALSO IS OUR MISSION TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A WORLD-CLASS VENUE THAT ENHANCES THE ENJOYMENT OF THESE ENTERTAINMENT AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; CONTRIBUTES TO THE CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC VITALITY OF THE COMMUNITY AND THE REGION; AND HONORS THE MEMORY OF COUNT BASIE.
IRS990.Description: In the year ended June 30, 2010 the Count Basie Theatre presented 93 performances of music, dance, theatre, film and education events by nationally recognized artists and ensembles; presented 114 arts education classes and workshops; and hosted 81 programs and performances presented by other arts organizations, charitable organizations and concert promoters.THE COUNT BASIE THEATRE'S PERFORMING ARTS ACADEMY OFFERS CLASSES AND WORKSHOPS WITH SEASONED PROFESSIONALS FOR ASPIRING ACTORS, MUSICIANS AND DANCERS OF ALL AGES. COURSE OFFERINGS ARE WIDE-RANGING, FROM PERFORMANCE BASICS, AUDITIONING TECHNIQUES AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE ARTS, TO FUN WEEKEND WORKSHOPS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Theatre believes that it has appropriate support for any tax positions taken, and as such, does not have any uncertain tax positions.
DIRECT EXPENSES RELATED TO ADVERTISING INCOME: 98877.
DIRECT EXPENSES RELATED TO ADVERTISING INCOME: 98877.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WILLIAM MARRACCINI AND JUDITH MARRUS (BOARD MEMBERS) AND NANCY MULHEREN (FOUNDATION BOARD MEMBER) ARE CO-OWNERS OF FRIENDS OF THE BASIE, LLC THAT PROVIDED SPACE RENTAL SERVICES DURING MAJOR EXTERIOR RENOVATION OF THE THEATRE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DRAFT OF FORM 990 IS SENT TO THE FULL BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION REQUESTS ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO SIGN AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY CERTIFICATION. IN ADDITION, BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUESTED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL FORM 990 DISCLOSURE, WHICH REQUESTS DISCLOSURE OF ANY INTEREST THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION OF ALL KEY EMPLOYEES IS DISCUSSED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD AND/OR COMMITTEE. COMPENSATION IS GENERALLY BASED ON INDUSTRY STANDARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ONLINE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG. ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE BOARD HAS APPROVED THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT.
